docs.title: hydraters
docs.text:
Hydrate Python dictionaries with Rust. A general-purpose algorithm, used in pgstac to reduce the size of the items table.

import hydraters

base = {"a": "first", "b": "second", "c": {"d": "third"}}
item = {"c": {"e": "fourth", "f": "fifth"}}
result = hyrdraters.hydrate(base, item)
assert result == {
    "a": "first",
    "b": "second",
    "c": {"d": "third", "e": "fourth", "f": "fifth"},
}

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
python -m pip install hydraters

Or, if you're using uv:

uv add hydraters

docs.title: Developing
docs.text:
Get Rust and uv. Then:

git clone git@github.com:developmentseed/hydraters.git
cd hydraters
uv sync
uv run pre-commit install

To run tests:

uv run pytest

docs.title: Background
docs.text: The code for this package was taken from pypgstac. It came from some benchmarking that determined it was much faster to do this operation in Rust than in pure Python.

docs.title: hydraters.dehydrate
docs.text:
dehydrate(base: dict[str, Any], item: dict[str, Any]) -> dict[str, Any]

Dehydrates an item using a base.

Parameters:

  • base (dict[str, Any]) –

    The base item to use for dehydration. Any values that are equal on the base and the itm will be removed from the item.

  • item (dict[str, Any]) –

    The item to be dehydrated. The item is mutated in-place, and also returned.

Returns:

  • dict[str, Any] –

    The dehydrated item.

docs.title: hydraters.hydrate
docs.text:
hydrate(base: dict[str, Any], item: dict[str, Any]) -> dict[str, Any]

Hydrates an item using a base.

Parameters:

  • base (dict[str, Any]) –

    The base item to use for hydration. Any values on the base that are not on the item will be added back to the item.

  • item (dict[str, Any]) –

    The item to hydrate. The item is mutated in-place and also returned.

Returns:

  • dict[str, Any] –

    The hydrated item.

docs.title: hydraters.DO_NOT_MERGE_MARKER module-attribute
docs.text:
DO_NOT_MERGE_MARKER: str

The magic marker that is used to indicate that a field should not be merged.
